thread.title: Review: Qantas Frequent Flyer American Express Premium Gold credit card - Airlines | flights | hotels | travel tech | style | apps
thread.title_full: Review: Qantas Frequent Flyer American Express Premium Gold credit card - Airlines | flights | hotels | travel tech | style | apps - Australian Business Traveller

author: ausbt.com.au
title: Review: Qantas Frequent Flyer American Express Premium Gold credit card - Airlines | flights | hotels | travel tech | style | apps
text:
With benefits such as free domestic and international travel insurance, two airport lounge visits each year and bonus points at supermarkets and petrol stations, the Qantas American Express Premium credit card takes a well-rounded approach to points and perks with a price tag that won't break the bank.
New customers can also take advantage of a 0.99% balance transfer offer for the first six months (plus a 1% balance transfer fee) – a great way to pay down an existing credit card debt without being stung with hefty interest charges.
Qantas American Express Premium card: fast facts Grade/tier: Gold Card type: American Express Loyalty program: Qantas Frequent Flyer Qantas Points earned per $1 – everyday spend: 1 Qantas Points earned per $1 – utilities, insurance (other than AMEX insurance), government payments: 0.5 Bonus points earned per $1 – eligible Qantas spend: 1 Bonus points earned per $1 – major supermarkets, petrol: 1 Points capping: Uncapped Fees, charges and interest: 3/5 Annual fee: $249 Additional/supplementary cardholder fee: $0 Interest rate on purchases: 20.74% p.a. Interest-free days on purchases: Up to 44 Interest rate on cash advances: N/A International transaction fee: 3.0% Minimum income requirement: $40,000 p.a. Minimum credit limit: $2,000 Earning points for free flights: 4/5
Pocket an easy 5,000 bonus points when first using your card, an extra 2,500 points on your first Qantas transaction and a further 22,500 bonus points on spending at least $500 in the first three months for an easy kick-start of 30,000 Qantas frequent flyer points.
That's in addition to the points you'd normally earn per dollar spent, and more than enough for a free one-way upgrade from flexible economy or premium economy to business class between Sydney and Hong Kong, or a return business class upgrade between Brisbane and Melbourne from the cheapest economy tickets.
Airport lounge access: 3/5 Your first Qantas spend doesn't just trigger bonus points, you'll also be sent two complimentary Qantas Club invitations to use on the journey and two more every year thereafter – valid in any domestic Qantas Club lounge or international Qantas business class lounge, excluding in Los Angeles.
Stop by the Qantas Singapore Lounge with one of your free Qantas Club passes On flights within the US, there's also the option to pay US$50 per visit for access to the American Express Centurion Lounges at airports such as New York (LaGuardia), Dallas/Fort Worth and San Francisco, although access to the American Express Sydney Airport lounge isn't included and can't be bought.
Free international travel insurance: 5/5 Use your Qantas American Express Premium card to pay for your flights and AMEX's free domestic and international travel insurance has you covered on trips of up to 62 days and up to a maximum of 120 total travel days per year.
That's a noticeable step above most other credit cards which only provide travel insurance on international jaunts and a subset of coverage on domestic itineraries.
Qantas American Express Premium card: our verdict On first glance, the Qantas American Express Premium card isn't the greatest for earning frequent flyer points, as the fee-free Qantas AMEX Discovery card actually earns twice the number of points per dollar with utilities, insurance providers and government bodies.
The similarly-priced NAB Qantas Rewards Premium cards also provide a higher everyday earning rate of 1.5/$1 and a backup Visa at no extra cost to use where AMEX isn't accepted, but is trumped by AMEX's own Premium card on both supermarket and petrol station spend, where you'll earn up to two points per $1.
You'll also find no points capping on the Qantas American Express Premium card, so you're free to spend as much as you can afford to repay while earning points on the lot – and when mixed with the cool 30,000-point welcome bonus could have you well on your way to your next free flight or upgrade.
Also read: Qantas American Express Ultimate credit card review
